auth.title: Authentication
auth.welcome:
[bright_white]Welcome to [red1]MCP[bright_white]Tool[bright_white]
The best Minecraft Pentesting tool
You do not have an account? Buy one at: [underline][bold]https://buy.mcptool.net[/bold][/underline]
auth.invalidCredentials: %prefix% [red1]Invalid credentials.[/red1][bright_white] If you forgot your password, you can reset it on the Discord server.
auth.unauthorizedDevice: %prefix% [red1]Unauthorized device.[/red1][bright_white] You've reached the maximum number of devices linked to your account. You can delete one by opening a ticket on the Discord server.
auth.apiOffline: %prefix% [red1]The API is currently offline. Please try again later.[/red1]

server.description: Get information from the specified server (motd, version, online players, etc.)

uuid.description: Get the UUID of the specified player or the username of the specified UUID

messages.usernameNotFound: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Username not found for the entered UUID. It's possibly invalid.[/bright_white]

ipinfo.description: Get information about the specified IP address

messages.error: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Could not get data from the entered IP. It's possibly invalid.[/bright_white]

iphistory.description: Get the IP history of the specified domain

messages.gettingIpHistory: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Getting IP history from the entered domain...[/bright_white]
messages.noIpHistory: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No IP history found for the entered domain.[/bright_white]

dnsrecords.description: Get the DNS records of the specified domain

messages.lookingUpDnsRecords: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Looking up DNS records from the entered domain [bright_black]([green1]%domain%[bright_black])[/bright_black]...
messages.noDnsRecords: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No DNS records found for the entered domain.[/bright_white]

checker.description: Check the status of a Minecraft server from a list of servers in a file

messages.noServersFound: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No servers found in the entered file.[/bright_white]

subdomains.description: Get the subdomains of the specified domain using a wordlist

messages.noSubdomains: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No subdomains found for the entered domain [bright_black]([green1]%domain%[bright_black]) [bright_white]using the entered wordlist.[/bright_white]

seeker.description: Search Minecraft servers using the Seeker API

token.note: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Note: If you authorized the application and the token is still not captured, restart the tool and run the command again.[/bright_white]
token.invalidToken: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Invalid token. Please use the [green1]seeker token[/green1] command to get a new token.[/bright_white]

servers.filterByData: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by data? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByCountryCode: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by country code? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByCountryCodeText: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the country code to filter the servers [bright_black]([green1]e.g. US[/green1])[/bright_black][/bright_white]
servers.filterByCracked: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by cracked status? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByDescription: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by description? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByDescriptionText: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the description to filter the servers [bright_black]([green1]e.g. survival[/green1])[/bright_black][/bright_white]
servers.filterByOnlyBungeeSpoofable: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by only BungeeCord spoofable? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByProtocol: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by protocol? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByProtocolText: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the protocol to filter the servers [bright_black]([green1]e.g. 47[/green1])[/bright_black][/bright_white]
servers.filterByOnlinePlayers: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by online players? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
servers.filterByOnlinePlayersText: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the minimum amount of online players to filter the servers [bright_black]([green1]e.g. 5[/green1])[/bright_black][/bright_white]
servers.noServers: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No servers found from the Seeker API.[/bright_white]

websearch.description: Search minecraft servers in multiple websites

messages.filterByData: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by data? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.filterByOnlyBotCanJoin: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to filter the servers by only bot can join? [bright_black]([red1]Offline Servers[bright_black]) ([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]

scan.description: Scan the specified IP address (or file with IP addresses) with the specified port range using nmap, qubo or masscan

messages.scanning: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Scanning the entered IP address [green1]%ip%[/green1] with the port range [green1]%portRange%[/green1] using the method [green1]%method%[/green1]...[/bright_white]
messages.noOpenPorts: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No open ports found in the entered IP address [green1]%ip%[/green1] with the port range [green1]%portRange%[/green1].[/bright_white]
messages.openPortsFound: %spaces%%prefix% [green1]%openPorts% [bright_white]open ports found in the entered IP address [green1]%ip%[/green1] with the port range [green1]%portRange%[/green1].[/bright_white]

listening.description: Listen to the specified server to get the list of players connecting to the server

messages.showPlayersMode: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Choose the mode to display the player's connections. [bright_black]([green1]simple table[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.invalidShowPlayersMode: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Invalid mode. Choose the mode to display the player's connections. [bright_black]([green1]simple table[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.verticalOverflowAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to enable the vertical overflow? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]

proxy.description: Create a proxy to connect to the specified server using a velocity proxy

messages.newVelocityVersionAvailable: %spaces%%prefix% [green1]A new version of Velocity is available![/green1]
messages.downloadingJar: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Downloading the proxy jar file from the Velocity website [bright_black]([bright_cyan]%jarName%[/bright_cyan])[/bright_white]
messages.jarDownloaded: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The proxy jar file has been downloaded successfully.[/bright_white]
messages.jarReplaced: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The proxy jar file has been replaced successfully.[/bright_white]
messages.proxyStarted: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The proxy has been started successfully in [green1]%proxyIp%:%proxyPort%[/green1].[/bright_white]

fakeproxy.description: Create a fake proxy to capture the data of the players connecting to the specified server

messages.updateMode:
%spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Select how the fakeproxy data will be updated.

%spaces% [green1]1)[/green1] [bright_white]For every ping received on the fakeproxy server, the proxy will get the data from the destination server and use it.

%spaces% [green1]2)[/green1] [bright_white]Every 3 seconds, MCPTool will get the data from the target server and apply it to the fakeproxy.
messages.protocolMode:
%spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Select how the protocol will be managed in the fakeproxy. 

%spaces% [green1]1)[/green1] [bright_white]It will be the same as the one on the backend server. [bright_black]([/bright_black]it will only allow you to enter the proxy with a specific version[bright_black]) 

%spaces% [green1]2)[/green1] [bright_white]It will always be the same as the client, allowing any version to enter the proxy. [bright_black]([/bright_black]It does not mean that all versions will be able to enter the backend server, only those that allows it[bright_black])[/bright_black]
messages.protocolModeInput: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Select the protocol mode for the fakeproxy. [bright_black]([green1]1 2[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.pinggyIO: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to use the pinggy.io service to get the public IP and port of the fakeproxy server? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.pinggyIOCommand: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Use the command [green1]ssh -p 443 -R0:localhost:%port% tcp@a.pinggy.io[/green1] to get the domain and port of the pinggy.io service.
messages.pinggyIODomain: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the domain of the pinggy.io service[/bright_white]
messages.gettingPinggyIP: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Getting the public IP and port of the fakeproxy server from the pinggy.io service...[/bright_white]
messages.couldNotGetPinggyIOIP: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_red]Could not get the public IP and port of the fakeproxy server from the pinggy.io service.[/bright_red]
messages.pinggyIOIPAndPort: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Public IP and port of the fakeproxy server. [bright_black]([green1]%ipAndPort%[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.adminKeyHelp: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_cyan]%time%[/bright_cyan] üîë [bright_white]Use the [bright_cyan]admin key [bright_white]to execute admin commands in the fakeproxy server[/bright_white]
messages.messageSent: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_cyan]%time%[/bright_cyan] ‚öîÔ∏è [bright_white] Message sent to the player [green1]%target% [bright_white]successfully ([bright_cyan]%message%[bright_white]). By [green1]%sender%[/green1]
messages.onlineModeError: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_cyan]%time%[/bright_cyan] üü° [red1]%username% [bright_black]([green1]%ipAddress%[bright_black]) [bright_white]can't connect to fake proxy server because backend server is in online mode.[/bright_white]

connect.description: Connect to the specified server using a bot

sendcmd.description: Send commands or messages to the specified server using a bot

messages.sendingCommands: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Sending the commands to the server [green1]%server%[/green1] using the bot [green1]%username%[/green1] and the commands from the file [bright_cyan]%commandsFile%[/bright_cyan] [bright_black](%commandsCount% commands)[/bright_black]...[/bright_white]

kick.description: Kick the specified player from the server using a bot

messages.proxyAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to use a proxy to kick the bot? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.customProxyAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to use a custom proxy to kick the bot? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.customProxy: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the IP address and port of the custom proxy [bright_black]([bright_cyan]Socks4[/bright_cyan][bright_black])[/bright_white]
messages.gettingFreeProxy: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Getting a free proxy to kick the bot...[/bright_white]
messages.playerKicked: %spaces%üí£ [bright_white]The player [green1]%username%[/green1] was kicked from the server.[/bright_white]
messages.errorKickingPlayer: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The player [green1]%username%[/green1] was not kicked from the server. Reason: [red1]%reason%[/red1][/bright_white]

kickall.description: Kick all players from the server using a bot

messages.proxyAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to use a proxy to kick all players? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.customProxiesAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to use custom proxies to kick all players? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.customProxies: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the file with the IP addresses and ports of the custom proxies [bright_black]([bright_cyan]Socks4[/bright_cyan][bright_black])[/bright_white]
messages.loopExecutionAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to run the command indefinitely? [bright_black]([bright_cyan]Stops with Ctrl C[bright_black]) [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.excludingPlayerAsk: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Do you want to exclude a player from being kicked? [bright_black]([green1]y/n[/green1])[/bright_black]
messages.excludingPlayer: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Enter the username of the player to exclude from being kicked[/bright_white]
messages.excludingUser: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The player [bright_cyan]%username%[/bright_cyan] will not be kicked from the server because it was excluded.[/bright_white]
messages.gettingFreeProxies: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Getting free proxies to kick all players...[/bright_white]
messages.failedToGetFreeProxies: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Failed to get a free proxies to kick all players. Try again later or use custom proxies.[/bright_white]
messages.invalidCustomProxies: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Valid proxies were not found in the file [bright_cyan]%file%[/bright_cyan]. Try again with a different file.[/bright_white]
messages.gettingPlayers: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Getting the list of players from the server...[/bright_white]
messages.serverOffline: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The server is offline. Retrying in [bright_cyan]%seconds% seconds[/bright_cyan]...[/bright_white]
messages.notJavaServer: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The server was detected as a bedrock server instead of Java. Retrying in [bright_cyan]%seconds% seconds[/bright_cyan]...[/bright_white]
messages.noPlayersFoundLoop: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]No players were found on the server. Retrying in [bright_cyan]%seconds% seconds[/bright_cyan]...[/bright_white]
messages.playersKicked: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]All players were kicked from the server.[/bright_white]
messages.playersKickedLoop: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]All players were kicked from the server. Executing the command again in [bright_cyan]%seconds% seconds[/bright_cyan]...[/bright_white]
messages.noPlayers: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]There are no players to kick from the server.[/bright_white]

botattack.description: Send a basic bot attack to the specified server

rcon.description: Connect to the RCON of the specified server

messages.connecting: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Connecting to the RCON of the server [green1]%server%[/green1]...[/bright_white]

shell.description: Listens on a specified port for incoming connections to execute remote shell commands.

errors.notJavaServer: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The server is not a Java server. This command only works with Java servers.[/bright_white]
errors.commandsFileNotFound: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Commands file not found. Please enter a valid commands file.[/bright_white]
errors.commandsFileEmpty: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The commands file is empty. Please enter a valid commands file.[/bright_white]
errors.permissionDenied: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Permission denied to execute %file%. Close MCPTool and execute the following command: [green1]%commandToFix%[/green1] to fix this issue.
errors.rootRequired: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Root permission is required to execute this command. Close MCPTool and run it as root to fix this issue.
errors.passwordApiError: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Error getting password from the API. Please try again later.[/bright_white]
errors.passwordApiInvalidResponse: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]Invalid response from the password API. Please try again later.[/bright_white]
errors.customPortRangeNotFound: %spaces%%prefix% [bright_white]The custom port range was not found. Please enter a valid custom port range.[/bright_white]
